data.name: Account_Edit_Intro
data.value: To request certificates you need to register with each of the Certificate Authorities that you want to use.

data.name: Account_Edit_Intro2
data.value: The email address provided may be used to notify you of upcoming certificate renewals if required. Invalid email addresses will be rejected by the Certificate Authority.

data.name: Send_Feedback_Tip
data.value: Thanks for submitting feedback to our developers. Please email support@certifytheweb.com if you have a question.

data.name: ImportDlg_OpComment
data.value: You are upgrading from an older version of Certify. This will create new Managed Certificates which you can then edit to adjust the renewal settings etc.

data.name: ImportDlg_Merge
data.value: Merge multiple domains/certificates per site into one Managed Certificate

data.name: Send_Feedback_Exception
data.value: Oops, something went wrong. Please tell us about it.

data.name: Send_Feedback_Success
data.value: Thanks, your feedback has now been submitted.

data.name: Send_Feedback_Error
data.value: Sorry, there was a problem submitting your feedback.

data.name: New_Contact_EmailError
data.value: There was a problem registering with the Certificate Authority using this email address. Check the email address is valid and that this computer has an open connection to the internet (outgoing https is required for API calls).

data.name: Account_Edit_AgreeConditions
data.value: To proceed, confirm that you agree to the current terms and conditions for this Certificate Authority.

data.name: Registration_NeedEmail
data.value: Please enter the email address you used when registering your key.

data.name: Registration_KeyValidationError
data.value: There was a problem trying to validate your license key. Please try again or contact support.

data.name: Registration_UnableToVerify
data.value: There was a problem beginning the license validation process.

data.name: ScheduledTaskConfig_AlreadyConfiged
data.value: The auto renewal task is already configured. If required you can change the admin user account used to execute the task.

data.name: ScheduledTaskConfig_FailedToCreateTask
data.value: Failed to create scheduled task with given credentials

data.name: ScheduledTaskConfig_PleaseProvideCredential
data.value: Please provide the username and password for an admin level user.

data.name: ScheduledTaskConfig_Tip
data.value: To perform auto renewal of certificates, a task will be created in the Windows Task Scheduler. This task needs to run as an Admin level user in order to do certificate management and IIS management tasks.

data.name: AboutControl_TrialDetailLabel
data.value: This version is free for evaluation and will manage a limited number of certificates. To remove this limitation please purchase a registration key at https://certifytheweb.com/register. Registered users can get support by emailing support@certifytheweb.com

data.name: UpdateCheckLatestVersion
data.value: You are using the latest version.

data.name: ManagedCertificates_NoItemSelectedTip
data.value: Select a Managed Certificate or select New Certificate to begin.

data.name: ManagedCertificates_UnsavedWarning
data.value: There are unsaved changes to the selected site. Discard changes?

data.name: ProgressMonitor_NoProgress
data.value: There are no requests currently in progress.

data.name: Settings_AutoRenewalRequestLimit
data.value: Maximum Auto Renewal Requests Per Session (0 = Unlimited)

data.name: Settings_EnableProxyApiForDomainConfig
data.value: Enable Proxy API for Domain Config Checks

data.name: Settings_EnableEFS
data.value: Enable Encrypted File System (EFS) for sensitive files. This option does not work on all versions of Windows.

data.name: Settings_IgnoreStoppedSites
data.value: Ignore stopped IIS sites for new certificates and renewals

data.name: Settings_EnableDnsValidation
data.value: Enable DNS Validation Checks (Resolution, CAA, DNSSEC)

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_NotifyPrimaryContactOnRenewalFailure
data.value: Notify Primary Contact On Renewal Failure

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_NoHostNameBindingWarning
data.value: At least one fully qualified hostname (e.g 'github.com') or wildcard (e.g. '*.github.com) is required to create a certificate.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_DomainIncluded
data.value: The following selected domains will be included as a single certificate request. The issuing Certificate Authority must be able to access all of these domains via port 80 (for HTTP challenges) or port 443 (for TLS-SNI challenges) for the certification process to work.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_ExportTip
data.value: Note: To export this certificate use the Manage Computer Certificates option in Windows.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_CertificateRevokeWarning
data.value: WARNING: This certificate has been revoked.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_SelectWebsiteOrCert
data.value: Select the site to create a certificate for.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_NameRequired
data.value: A name is required for this item.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_NeedPrimaryDomain
data.value: A Primary Domain must be included

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_ChallengeNotAvailable
data.value: The {0} challenge is only available for IIS versions 8+.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_HookMustBeValidUrl
data.value: The Url for the webhook must be set to a valid Url.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_HookMethodMustBeSet
data.value: The Method for the webhook must be set.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_NoChanges
data.value: No changes were made, skipping save

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_ConfirmDelete
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this item? Deleting the item will not affect IIS settings etc.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_LogNotCreated
data.value: The log file for this item has not been created yet.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_CertificateNotReady
data.value: The certificate file for this item has not been created yet or the file has been deleted.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_CannotChallengeWithoutIIS
data.value: Cannot check challenges if IIS is not available.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_ConfirmRevokeCertificate
data.value: Are you sure you want to revoke this certificate?

data.name: MainWindow_TrialLimitationReached
data.value: You are using the evaluation version of this app. Please purchase a registration key to upgrade. See the Register option on the About tab.

data.name: MainWindow_RenewAllConfirm
data.value: This will renew certificates for all auto-renewed items, if applicable. Proceed?

data.name: MainWindow_IISNotAvailable
data.value: IIS Was not detected on this server, important functionality will be unavailable. If you know IIS is installed and working on this server, please report this error to support@certifytheweb.com providing details of your server Operating System version and IIS versions

data.name: MainWindow_GetStartGuideWithNewCert
data.value: Get started by registering a new contact, then you can start requesting certificates.

data.name: Update_MandatoryUpdateQuit
data.value: The current app version requires an essential update to ensure continued operation. Please update immediately. Close app now?

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_BindingNote
data.value: Note: these setting only apply to new https bindings, existing bindings are only updated with the new certificate. Using a fixed IP for multiple certificates will cause a binding conflict on Windows, use with caution.

data.name: GettingStarted_DashboardIntro
data.value: You can use the reporting dashboard to easily view certificate renewal status across one or more servers.

data.name: Dashboard_AddIntro
data.value: To add this server to your dashboard, provide your https://certifytheweb.com/profile sign in details or register a new account:

data.name: ScheduledTaskConfig_UseBackgroundService
data.value: Use Background Service (runs as Local System)

data.name: ScheduledTaskConfig_UseScheduledTask
data.value: Use a Scheduled Task (runs as specified user)

data.name: Update_DownloadNow
data.value: Would you like to automatically download the update? You will be notified when it is ready to apply.

data.name: Update_ReadyToApply
data.value: A new update is ready to apply. Would you like to install it now?

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_InvalidSNI
data.value: You are attempting to create an SNI binding that also has a specific bound IP address. It is recommended that SNI bindings use All Unassigned instead. Do you wish to continue saving?

data.name: Update_DownloadFailed
data.value: Sorry, the update could not be downloaded. Please try again later.

data.name: MainWindow_KeyExpired
data.value: Your license key has expired or is no longer active.

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_DomainsIntro
data.value: Select domains from existing hostname bindings on an website or add the domains manually. You can then select Request Certificate above or modify options as required. To specify a custom CSR see the Advanced tab.

data.name: Credentials_Intro
data.value: Stored credentials are required to make automated calls to APIs and other resources during certificate renewal and deployment. These credentials are protected using the Windows Data Protection APIs and stored on this machine.

data.name: ManagedCertificates_Deployment_Intro
data.value: Deployment of your certificate can be automatic or you can perform your own deployment tasks (see the Tasks tab).

data.name: ManagedCertificates_Tasks_Intro
data.value: Tasks are an optional way to work with your latest certificate or trigger other actions before or after renewal.

data.name: ManagedCertificates_Tasks_DeploymentIntro
data.value: Deployment Tasks run (in the order shown) after the standard Deployment process has completed (see the Deployment tab). Tasks can be run immediately after the certificate has updated or they can be deferred (to run manually or via a scheduled task etc.). You can also drag tasks to re-order them:

data.name: ManagedCertificates_Tasks_PrerequestIntro
data.value: You can optionally add any number of tasks to run before the certificate request begins:

data.name: ManagedCertificateSettings_CertificateAuthority_Intro
data.value: Certificate Authorities are the organisations who can issue trusted certificates. You need to register an account under Settings for each (ACME) Certificate Authority you wish to use.

data.name: Settings_CA_Intro
data.value: Certificate Authorities are the organisations who can issue trusted certificates. You need to register an account for each (ACME) Certificate Authority you wish to use. Accounts can either be Production (live, trusted certificates) or Staging (test, non-trusted).

data.name: Settings_CA_Fallback
data.value: If you register with multiple authorities this may enable you to use automatic Certificate Authority Failover, so if your preferred Certificate Authority can't issue a new certificate an alternative compatible provider can be used automatically.

data.name: Settings_Export_Intro
data.value: You can create an export file to bundle all of the related settings and file for this instance together. Note: sensitive content is encrypted but you should not share this file with untrusted sources or use unsecured storage.
